8:00.race_name: Unibet More Extra Place Races Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Bishops Crown
runners.comment: Two 6f handicap wins last year, including after a break; fair mark for return; contender
runners.spotlight: Made a winning reappearance at Windsor one year ago (6f, good) and added a Salisbury handicap last September; placed in both AW starts here as a 2yo; feasible mark ahead of his return and he's well drawn; one for the shortlist.

stable_tour.quote: He has run seven times and in the last six of them has been placed. I still can't believe I have not won with him yet. He had been running over 1m so I dropped him to 7f and he was third, and last weekend he ran over 6f at Leicester and the poor old boy just found one too good again. He is a lovely horse and a win is surely around the corner. 11-07-23

runners.name: Blue Day
runners.comment: Just one win but consistent and progressive; conditions fine; won fresh last year; solid
runners.spotlight: Just one win to his name but he is still low mileage and brings a solid AW profile into the race; won fresh last April and he's high on the list despite a double-figure stall.

runners.name: Intervention
runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: 7f Lingfield win on latest AW run; solid turf run (5f) last week; should be competitive
runners.spotlight: Belatedly took advantage of his reduced mark when making all in a 7f handicap at Lingfield last month; good fourth off this mark at Pontefract last week (5f; ridden by Mason Paetel); should remain competitive.

quotes.race: Win £2,000,000 With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: It was a fantastic win again and Intervention is just an amazing horse. That's eleven wins since we bought him, his last four on the bounce. He's going on seven, in the form of his life and is better than ever. It secures at least sharing the top prize for the all-weather horse of the month at the Arc (Arena Racing Company) tracks in December because that's three wins from his last three runs. We're thrilled with him, he came to us as a longstanding maiden and Mick's just worked wonders with him. He's a bit of a hero of ours, he's won more races for us than any other horse and he's a firm favourite - Chris Dixon, syndicate boss.

stable_tour.quote: Our winningmost horse with 11 victories. He had quite a few goes before we bought him and he's won all those races for us and well over £100,000 in prize-money. He's just a legend. He runs his race nearly every time and always seems to be in the money. He's come down to a good mark again for the all-weather season and he's ready to win again soon. He's having a break now and usually thrives through the winter. 26-09-24

runners.name: Eminency
runners.comment: Returns from 8-month absence off a reduced mark; had wind op since last run; drawn wide
runners.spotlight: Remains with just a 2yo novice win to his name but the pick of last season's efforts would give him good claims off his reduced mark; had wind surgery during his eight-month absence; drawn wide for his return.

stable_tour.quote: He's always been a laid-back character and I'm really pleased with how he's done over the winter. He had nowhere to go on his comeback at Kempton and hopefully he can move forward from that run and have better luck next time. He wouldn't want it too soft, is versatile at six or seven furlongs and I hope he can keep progressing. 02-05-23

He has only won the once but he has run consistently well in defeat apart from last time at Newmarket where he got a bit behind the pace and that cost him any chance. His penultimate run behind Quinault at York reads well and I'm looking at going back to the July course if conditions are in his favour and it dries out as he is not far off winning again. He may even run in the Stewards' Cup on Saturday. 02-08-23

runners.name: Treacherous
runners.comment: Conditions to suit and ran well when last seen; now an 11yo though & returns in warm race
runners.spotlight: Veteran who has run well fresh in the past; ended 2024 with two good C&D runs but surprising if a few of today's rivals didn't have his measure.

quotes.race: Unibet Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: Treacherous is a big horse and he's taken time to mature. He's not been over raced considering his age and he would be relatively fragile; he spends most of his time between races swimming. He doesn't do a lot in front either which helps his mark. We might look for a Listed race for him at some point and we'd like to give him a break soon enough as well. I wanted to try him on the turf as I thought he could be at least as good as he is on the all-weather and I'd like to try more on the turf if possible rather than the all-weather - Ed de Giles, trainer.

runners.name: Danger Alert
runners.comment: Returns from 202 days off on a lowly mark; no headgear and perhaps best watched
runners.spotlight: Thrown in on his 3yo form and even last year's best would give him claims off this mark; 202-day absence to contend with though and goes without headgear.

quotes.race: tote £100K Guaranteed Placepot Every Day Handicap
quotes.quote: Danger Alert has been an enigma. William knows him very well now and he needs to get there late - the interference probably helped him because otherwise he might have got there too soon - and he puts his head up a little - George Boughey, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: You cannot fault him this year as he has already won three times, including last time at Chester over 5f. He never does a huge amount at home so is difficult to gauge, but the important thing is he saves his best for the track. He has shown a liking for slower ground, but I don't think quicker going will be a problem as he's a very versatile. I never saw him getting as high as 94, but he is in good shape and his target next week is the Palace of Holyroodhouse Handicap. 14-06-23

runners.name: Thursdays Child
runners.comment: Interesting on last year's best; makes her stable debut in a competitive race though
runners.spotlight: Made a fine start to her career, winning at Newcastle and Pontefract on her first two starts before finishing a good fourth at York's Dante meeting; in and out afterwards before changing hands for 16,000gns last October; still has potential for her new yard but will be found easier openings than this.

runners.name: Al Ameen
runners.breeder: G H S Bloodstock & J C Bloodstock
runners.comment: Impressive over 7f here the last twice; well in but drop in trip/stall 12 dent confidence
runners.spotlight: Always had plenty of ability but slow starts often held him back; enjoying a new lease of life since headgear was taken off, winning here last month and then bolting up, again over 7f, last week; looks well ahead of the handicapper under a 5lb penalty but the drop back in trip and widest stall temper enthusiasm slightly.

quotes.race: Betway Median Auction Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Al Ameen was slowly away on his debut and he walked out again. They went quick and he warmed into it. He got his head down and he tried very hard. He'll stay further. The fact he could win after a start like that was very encouraging - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

runners.name: Twilight Madness
runners.owner: P R Hedger & P C F Racing Ltd
runners.comment: Could build on recent return from a year off but he'll need to in this competitive affair
runners.spotlight: In good form last winter; attracted some support back from a year off at Lingfield two weeks ago but tired in the final furlong; needs to leave that behind.

quotes.race: BetUK Over 40,000 Live Streamed Races Handicap
quotes.quote: Twilight Madness gave me a really good feel up to halfway but the horse who was making it couldn't really take me far enough and he was dossing a bit once in front - Jason Hart, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Capotes Dream
runners.comment: Infrequent winner in recent years; C&D winner and can go well fresh; each-way shout
runners.spotlight: Just one win to his name since August 2021; no problem with the conditions and has gone well after a break in the past; each-way shout.

quotes.race: Coral Stewards' Sprint Handicap (Consolation Race For The Stewards' Cup)
quotes.quote: Capote's Dream ran super. The race came over to the far side, and he is a horse that likes to come through them. I would have loved to have got out two strides earlier, and it probably suited him in that regard - Tom Marquand, jockey.

runners.name: Liosa
runners.comment: On a sharp upward curve when last seen; needs further progress in this higher grade
runners.spotlight: Progressive at a low level last autumn, winning two of his last three starts; starts this campaign off a new 8lb higher mark and this demands another career best.

runners.name: Tiger Tulip
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with two quiet runs; returns in a warm event and others are more appealing
runners.spotlight: Not at her best on final two starts last year and she returns to action in a warm event; others are more appealing.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands C-D 3 Runs Or Fewer) (GBB)
quotes.quote: Everything went smoothly. Tiger Tulip was away nicely and we just took a tow into the race off the favourite. She's still very inexperienced so I thought I'd squeeze her in between two (rivals) in the home straight and she picked up nicely - Cieren Fallon, jockey, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

8:30.race_name: Industry Leading In-Play Markets At Unibet Handicap

runners.name: Odin Legacy
runners.comment: Not discredited in blinkers when fourth at Chelmsford 12 days ago; one to consider
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who wasn't discredited in blinkers after five months off when fourth of nine in 1m2f Chelmsford handicap 12 days ago; one to consider.

runners.name: Damascus Steel
runners.comment: C&D winner but he beat only two in 1m4f Lingfield handicap when last seen out in January
runners.spotlight: C&D winner but he beat only two in 1m4f Lingfield handicap when last seen out in January; he needs to bounce back after a break.

quotes.race: At The Races App Form Study Handicap
quotes.quote: Damascus Steel had shown a fair bit in his last three starts and it was just about finding out what was best for him. We tried different tactics today - going forward - and it seems to have done the trick, while we also added the blinkers to sharpen him up and that seems to have worked too. He's done it nicely and can hopefully win again for the owners. You'd say he'd get further, but I think we'll probably stay at this trip. I wouldn't be opposed to dropping back in trip but that's up the guv'nor. He goes on most ground - Jack Morland, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Sugarloaf Lenny
runners.comment: Looked rusty after five months off when eighth at Leicester 11 days ago; not ruled out now
runners.spotlight: Scored three times at up to 1m4f in 2024 and he looked rusty after five months off when eighth of ten in 1m4f handicap at Leicester 11 days ago; he's not ruled out with cheekpieces now added.

quotes.race: Steve Watts 20yrs At Lingfield Park Handicap
quotes.quote: Sugarloaf Lenny got the mile and a half well today, which opens up a few more avenues. He's got an upward profile and the handicapper can't be too harsh, because he's only just winning - William Knight, trainer.

runners.name: Caprelo
runners.comment: Made a winning return here in 2024; largely progressive after; very much one to consider
runners.spotlight: Made a winning return over 1m3f here in 2024 and largely progressive after until coming in last of seven on soft ground at York in October; gelded since and appeals as the sort to go on again, so he's very much one to consider.

stable_tour.quote: He won at Kempton in April and was  second last time at Windsor, where the ground was too quick. I'm not sure he's quite as good as Marmelo and Vent De Force, who were also out of Capriolla, but I think next year he will be quite progressive. 06-06-24

runners.name: Bas Bleu
runners.comment: Hooded and off the mark here in October; form has been franked, so she's not taken lightly
runners.spotlight: Hooded for first time when getting off the mark in 1m3f handicap here in October; off since but that form has worked out well, so she's not taken lightly with the headgear retained.

runners.name: Syllabus
runners.comment: Off 17 months before pulled up on yard/hurdling debut at Southwell latest; has it to prove
runners.spotlight: A fair maiden at up to 1m4f for William Haggas in 2023 but off for 17 months before being pulled up on yard/hurdling debut at Southwell last month; he has a bit to prove now.

runners.name: Federated
runners.comment: C&D scorer; very good third at Newcastle latest; bold showing on the cards off same mark
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer who comes here on the up, posting a very good third of seven in 1m2f handicap at Newcastle 17 days ago; another bold showing is on the cards off an unchanged mark.

quotes.race: Extra Winnings With BetUK Acca Club Handicap
quotes.quote: It was like a piece of work to be honest. The front horse went off and I had something to aim at, I picked him up well and Federated has done it nicely - Oisin Orr, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Brodies Boy
runners.breeder: S C E A Du Haras Des Sablonnets Et Al
runners.comment: C&D scorer but yet to hit top form this year; he needs to take a big step forward
runners.spotlight: Opened his account over C&D last spring but he's yet to hit top form in a pair of 1m4f handicaps at Lingfield and Wolverhampton this year; needs to take a big step forward.

runners.name: One Cool Dreamer
runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs L Peacock
runners.comment: A dual 1m2f scorer in 2024; possibilities on his seasonal return
runners.spotlight: A dual 1m2f scorer last summer and not disgraced when seventh in 1m4f Southwell handicap in October on his final run, racing wide; possibilities on his seasonal return.

quotes.race: Jenningsbet Halstead Handicap
quotes.quote: I feel One Cool Dreamer will get a mile and a half. He enjoyed the good even pace and I thought he pulled out a bit more when the second, ridden by my father, came to me - David Egan, jockey.

runners.name: Detroit Lion
runners.comment: Good Pontefract second week ago; can go well again off the same mark in bid for maiden win
runners.spotlight: Arrives in very good nick, runner-up in 1m4f Pontefract handicap a week ago; he can go well again off the same mark in his bid for a breakthrough victory.

runners.name: Ocean Heights
runners.comment: Hinted at a revival when fifth at Southwell last month; considered from a falling mark
runners.spotlight: C&D winner who hinted at a revival when fifth of eight in 1m3f Southwell handicap last month; he's one to consider from a falling mark.

runners.name: Pursuit Of Truth
runners.comment: Off five months before beating one on yard debut at Wolverhampton; stamina to prove
runners.spotlight: A fair 1m maiden for Owen Burrows in 2024; off five months before beating only one on his yard debut in 8.5f Wolverhampton handicap 15 days ago; takes a big step up in trip with better needed.

runners.name: Gold Souk

prev_owners.owner: Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed Al Maktoum

runners.comment: A fair 1m4f winner in 2023 but last of seven at Wolverhampton after 23 months off
runners.spotlight: A fair 1m4f winner in 2023 but he came in last of seven after 23 months off in 1m6f Wolverhampton handicap 15 days ago.

quotes.race: Novibet Handicap
quotes.quote: Gold Souk had been missing the break but the cheekpieces have helped today and he was just dossing a bit when he hit the front - Joshua Bryan, jockey.

runners.name: Ciotog
runners.comment: Back on track when third of seven in 8.5f handicap 15 days ago; shortlisted
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways at Wolverhampton (8.5f) in January and he got back on track when third of seven in 8.5f handicap there 15 days ago; shortlisted.

runners.name: Dream Pirate
runners.breeder: C R Withers & Mr & Mrs R Reed

prev_owners.owner: N Bromley, S Spampanato, R And E J Reed

runners.comment: Signed off for 2024 with good fifth at Southwell in December; not ruled out on his return
runners.spotlight: Scored at Nottingham (1m) in October and signed off for 2024 with a solid fifth of 12 in 1m Southwell handicap in December; not ruled out on his seasonal return.

quotes.race: Download The Vickers.Bet App Handicap (Div I)
quotes.quote: The weather could have been better and we were worried about the easy ground, but Dream Pirate handled it well - Nick Bromley, owner.

runners.name: Love Your Work
runners.comment: Won at Chelmsford in March; not best drawn when tenth at Doncaster latest; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Back to winning ways at Chelmsford (1m) in March and not best drawn when tenth of 21 in 1m Doncaster handicap 16 days ago; possibilities.

quotes.race: Bombardier Golden Beer Handicap
quotes.quote: It's a unique surface so previous form at the course helps a lot. Love Your Work is declared for Friday and as long as he's all right, he'll run again - Tim Fitzgerald, trainer.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes Home Of The Odds Boost Handicap
quotes.quote: Adam said go forward. Love Your Work did have a look, he was a bit lairy in front, but the blinkers have done the job for him. I knew I had to put on a strong gallop. My horse will be better the next time and probably even better dropped back to seven furlongs - Robbie Walsh, jockey.

runners.name: Francesi
runners.comment: On lengthy losing run but good third at Lingfield on return; can make his presence felt
runners.spotlight: On a lengthy losing run but he posted a good third of 11 in 1m Lingfield handicap on his return last month; he can make his presence felt again.

runners.name: Newfangled
runners.comment: Encouraging third at Lingfield on return; a big player with usual cheekpieces refitted
runners.spotlight: Ended 2024 on the up (a three-time AW winner at up to 1m2f) and he resumed from five months off with a promising third of 11 in 1m2f Lingfield handicap 22 days ago; a big player with his usual cheekpieces now refitted.

runners.name: Port Erin
runners.comment: C&D scorer but he arrives below par, only seventh of 11 over 6f here 20 days ago
runners.spotlight: C&D scorer but he arrives below par, only seventh of 11 over 6f here 20 days ago; he needs to get back on track.

quotes.race: At The Races App Market Movers Handicap (Div II)
quotes.quote: I spoke to Jack Mitchell who has done a lot of work on Port Erin and he said 'he's just a galloper' so I was quite happy to go and do my own thing. He got into a nice rhythm on the front end and when I didn't get hassle for the first couple of furlongs, I knew he was going to take a lot of beating then - P J McDonald, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Mr Fustic

prev_owners.owner: Dave Tonge, Steph Collins Phil Mills

runners.comment: Arrives in good nick; this C&D winner enters calculations once more
runners.spotlight: Scored at Lingfield (1m) in February and has recorded good placed efforts at Wolverhampton and Chelmsford since; this C&D winner enters calculations once more.

quotes.race: Win £1M With BetMGM's Golden Goals Handicap
quotes.quote: Mr Fustic has been very disappointing. His work had been good but it might've been something to do with the first-time tongue strap. It's good to get the confidence back. Mr Fustic is better than this and hopefully it sparks him up again  - Dylan Hogan, jockey.

runners.name: Happy Chandler
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with below-par seventh at Salisbury in August; needs to hit ground running
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who ended 2024 with a below-par seventh in 1m Salisbury handicap in August; he needs to hit the ground running on his Tapeta debut.

runners.name: Angelica K
runners.comment: C&D winner; good third at Southwell a week ago; she's in the picture off the same mark
runners.spotlight: Got off the mark over C&D in February and recorded a good third of 13 in 1m Southwell handicap a week ago; she's in the picture off the same mark.

runners.name: Autumn Festival
runners.comment: Last of eight at Haydock in October; has gone well fresh so claims off a reduced mark
runners.spotlight: It's now 15 starts since his last victory and he came in last of eight in 1m Haydock handicap in October; has gone well fresh though so he's not ruled out off a reduced mark.

stable_tour.quote: He won seven races for us last year, so it's hard to think he's well handicapped. He'll improve for his comeback and will run himself back into form. He likes to lead. 04-05-23

4:55.race_name: Unibet Supporting Safer Gambling Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Damzon
runners.comment: Failed to beat rival on Flat debut at Wolver four weeks ago; very hard to make a case for
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden hurdler who failed to beat a rival on his Flat debut in 8.5f novice at Wolverhampton four weeks ago; she's very hard to make a case for.

runners.name: Lalique
runners.comment: Siyouni filly; a considered newcomer, especially if the market vibes are positive
runners.spotlight: Siyouni filly; half-sister to 7f 2yo/1m AW winner Mulciber (RPR 68); dam, runner-up over 2m (RPR 54), is closely related to US 1m3f Grade 1 winner Highland Chieftain; a considered newcomer.

runners.name: Lieutenant Lily
runners.comment: Eighth here on her debut in October; needs to take a big step forward over longer trip
runners.spotlight: 33-1, eighth of 13 in 7f novice here on her debut in October; this daughter of Cracksman needs to take a big step forward over this longer trip.

runners.name: Luminoso
runners.comment: Promising debut second at Southwell; hard to beat with improvement very much on the cards
runners.spotlight: Evens, made a promising start when second of eight in 1m maiden at Southwell 11 days ago; this well-related daughter of Kodiac fetched £430,000 as a yearling and looks hard to beat with improvement very much on the cards.

runners.name: Shaffron
runners.comment: Sea The Moon filly; plenty to like on paper so this debutante enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Sea The Moon filly is closely related to Italian 1m3f winner Shamshad and a half-sister to winners Shamkala (French 1m-10.5f Group 3; RPR 111) and Shamiyla (French 1m; RPR 97); dam, 1m3f and 1m4f (Listed) winner (RPR 103), is a half-sister to Italian 1m4f Group 1 winner Shamdala; plenty to like on paper so this debutante enters calculations.

7:00.race_name: Try Unibet's New Smartview Racecards Handicap

runners.name: Warrnambool
runners.comment: Failed to build on the promise of C&D debut in two further 2yo runs; stable/h'cap debut
runners.spotlight: Made a promising debut over C&D last October but he failed to build on it in two further runs for Sir Mark Prescott; could do with settling better if he's to fulfil his potential; ridden by a 7lb claimer on stable debut.

runners.name: Blewburton
runners.comment: This will be easier than his Dubai assignments but maybe vulnerable to less-exposed rivals
runners.spotlight: Ready winner on debut (5f, soft) one year ago and he ran well for third at Salisbury on his second start; progress has levelled off since and he hasn't made much impact in Dubai this year; down in the weights with cheekpieces now replacing blinkers.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: It's hard to know what he has beaten but Blewburton is a nice horse. He wants six furlongs but they went hard and it suited him. It can be tricky with a penalty and we may look at the Woodcote at Epsom - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

runners.name: Jersey Maverick
runners.owner: Tim Cottier, Clark, Spence And Fellowes
runners.comment: Improvement needed on 2yo form but the longer trip and new cheekpieces could spark it
runners.spotlight: Improved his RPR with each of his four runs as a 2yo; steps up in distance for his handicap/seasonal debut and cheekpieces are new too; one to note for market confidence.

runners.name: Invincible Melody
runners.comment: Second in all three handicaps (7f, AW); no obvious reason why he won't be involved again
runners.spotlight: His three handicap runs, all over 7f on AW, have seen him finish second; came from off the pace to chase home an unexposed opponent at Wolverhampton ten days ago; runs off the same mark and he looks a strong contender once again.

runners.name: Orchard
runners.breeder: Nasser Abdulla A A Al Mesned, Ali Thame
runners.comment: Likely he's better than we saw last year but he'll need a good pace at this trip on return
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in five runs as a 2yo but that doesn't tell the whole story and the likelihood is he's capable of much better at some point; finished fastest of all when eighth over C&D when last seen (poorly positioned) and although an extra furlong might suit better, he's worth a market check on his return to action.

runners.name: Blue Seeker
runners.comment: Good third at Wolverhampton ten days ago but more will be needed to take this
runners.spotlight: Easy win on his nursery debut on Boxing Day (7f, Tapeta) but he was hit with an 8lb rise and life quickly got harder; back to form when third at Wolverhampton ten days ago and he can race off 1lb lower today; needs a bit more if he is to double his tally.

runners.name: Knights Gold
runners.comment: Has ability but doesn't look straightforward, hanging but making late headway here latest
runners.spotlight: Finished his race off well here three weeks ago but he raced freely again and wandered around a bit when initially asked for his effort; much depends on how he settles early.

runners.name: Optimatum
runners.comment: No improvement for the switch to handicaps ten days ago; can do better but needs to
runners.spotlight: Attracted support on his handicap debut (7f, Tapeta) ten days ago but he dropped away late on (finished behind Invincible Melody); has time to do better but it is a requirement.

runners.name: Prince Of Joy
runners.comment: Best 2yo run came over C&D; unexposed; market useful on stable/seasonal/handicap debut
runners.spotlight: The pick of his three 2yo runs came over C&D in October when last seen, recording an RPR of 61; has left Eve Johnson Houghton since (same owner); may do better in handicaps this year.

runners.name: Split Silk
runners.owner: R Barnett And Mrs B V Sangster
runners.comment: Likely improver now handicapping at a realistic level; betting to guide
runners.spotlight: Modest form in three fillies' maiden/novice events as a 2yo; made some late headway at Southwell on her last start though and she's bred to be a good deal better than her opening mark; market useful.

5:30.race_name: Unibet 40,000+ Live Streamed Events Restricted Maiden Fillies' Stakes (Bands B, C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.name: Good Eye
runners.owner: The Upt North Darn South Syndicate
runners.comment: Modest form in a bumper and two Flat runs (stable debut latest); no appeal
runners.spotlight: Modest form in a bumper and two Flat runs (stable debut latest); no appeal.

runners.name: Appetiser
runners.comment: Last month's Wolverhampton debut offered hope of better; not discounted
runners.spotlight: Showed some promise when fourth of nine, beaten over 8l, on last month's Wolverhampton debut (7f); open to improvement and this isn't a strong contest; betting instructive.

runners.name: Be An Angel
runners.comment: Solid return to action ten days ago but that was 5f and her stamina isn't assured
runners.spotlight: Ran as well as she ever has when a close fifth of nine at Wolverhampton ten days ago (5f); stays 6f but stamina for today's trip has to be taken on trust.

runners.name: Bela Sonata
runners.comment: Green when down the field on her debut but that was Glorious Goodwood; open to improvement
runners.spotlight: Too green to do herself justice in a 7f fillies' maiden at Glorious Goodwood 257 days ago; the fact she was starting out there is encouraging though and she could prove a different proposition this year.

runners.name: Dianarina
runners.comment: Both starts have been promising and she's capable of better; more appealing than many
runners.spotlight: Shaped better than the distance beaten in one run in France as a 2yo; good second from a wide stall on last month's British debut; should continue to progress and more appealing than most of today's field.

runners.name: Ironist
runners.comment: 60,000gns yearling; half-sister to four winners but perhaps a longer-term prospect
runners.spotlight: 60,000gns yearling; eighth foal; half-sister to winners Amazonian Dream (5f/6f; RPR 97), Safari Dream (5f 2yo; 88), Savannah's Dream (5f; 86) and Savannah's Show (5f 2yo; 70); dam 5f/6f winner (81); stable not renowned for winning newcomers.

runners.name: Iconnic
runners.comment: Eyecatching debut effort at Lingfield 18 days ago (7f); open to plenty of improvement
runners.spotlight: Unconsidered 66-1 shot on her Lingfield debut (7f) 18 days ago but she showed clear promise, keeping on to finish a never-dangerous fifth (Dianarina second); open to improvement and interesting to see if she's stronger in the market today.

runners.name: Lilac Wine
runners.comment: 25,000gns yearling; dam a 1m3f and 2m4f (Listed winner); drawn wide; may need further
runners.spotlight: 25,000gns yearling; first foal of a German 1m3f and 2m4f (Listed) winner (RPR 93); drawn widest on debut and made need further in time.

runners.name: Cameley Days
runners.comment: Half-sister to minor sprint winner Twayblade (RPR 64); hooded for debut; check betting
runners.spotlight: Second foal; half-sister to 5.7f/6f winner Twayblade (RPR 64); dam 6f winner (75); hooded for debut; only of interest if attracting market support.

runners.name: Estimaid
runners.owner: H J Jarvis & Mrs P Jarvis
runners.comment: Well-beaten 125-1 shot over C&D last August; not easily recommended
runners.spotlight: 125-1 and offered little when 12th of 14 over C&D last August; better drawn today but still not easily recommended.

runners.name: Eulalia
runners.comment: Dam a 7f/7.6f winner; starts out at realistic level; market confidence would be a positive
runners.spotlight: Second foal of a 7f/7.6f winner (RPR 71), herself a half-sister to useful 6f-1m2f winner Chiefofchiefs; starts out in a winnable event and the betting should provide clues.

runners.name: Juno Star
runners.owner: The Ten Fools & A Horse Partnership
runners.comment: Reappearance effort wasn't without hope; step up to 7f can spark further progress
runners.spotlight: Found a 5f Newmarket maiden far too competitive last spring but her reappearance fifth at Wolverhampton (6f) in February was quite encouraging; extra furlong can help.

runners.name: Linear Spirit
runners.comment: 21,000euros half-sister to three winners; dam a 1m2f winner; worth a second look
runners.spotlight: 21,000euros yearling; half-sister to winners Luna Dorada (Listed-placed 1m 2yo; RPR 94), Galah (1m 2yo, 83; 2m hurdle) and Lunacy (1m3f; 71); dam 1m2f winner (78); enough paper appeal to warrant a second look.

runners.name: Little She
runners.comment: Promise here (6f) on debut before beaten fav 3 weeks later; 7f should suit; can do better
runners.spotlight: Shaped well over 6f here on her debut last October; beaten favourite at Chelmsford three weeks later but still ran to a level that would give her good claims in this field; step up to 7f should suit; contender.

7:30.race_name: Try Unibet's New Improved Acca Boosts Handicap (London Sprint Series Qualifier)

runners.name: Queue Dos
runners.comment: AW winner at two (6f); promising reappearance here last month (7f); one to consider
runners.spotlight: She had been threatening last season prior to breaking her duck when fitted with cheekpieces for the first time at Wolverhampton in September (6f); subsequent heavy-ground flop easy to forgive and she made a solid return when third over 7f here three weeks ago; one to consider back sprinting.

stable_tour.quote: She's for the same owners as Queues Likely and I think she's going to be very good. I think she'll definitely end up a black-type filly, most likely over a mile or seven furlongs. I was pleased with the way she ran at Bath because I thought she'd run a nice race as she'd been working lovely at home. Her half-brother was second in the Brocklesby and was sold to America straight away after that. He has run well in a big race in America and it's going to end up quite a nice page. She's got the size and scope. 04-07-24

runners.name: Mighty Ruler
runners.comment: One 2yo run that gives him claims; sold for 2,000gns since latest; no tongue-tie today
runners.spotlight: 0-5 for Eve Johnson Houghton but he ran well on his nursery debut (first run after gelding/wind operations) last November; less good at Southwell in February, after which he was sold for 2,000gns; tongue-tie absent this time.

runners.name: My Mate Kev
runners.comment: Unexposed AW maiden winner; drawn wide but could well be better than this mark
runners.spotlight: Shaped nicely behind useful opposition on his Yarmouth debut last October and he rewarded market support at Chelmsford 16 days later when taking on less demanding rivals (both 6f); has the widest draw to defy on his seasonal/handicap debut but the best could be still to come from him.

runners.name: Fleetwater
runners.owner: Ms H N Pinniger And Partner
runners.comment: Consistent but not progressive at 2; her win came when ridden by B Loughnane; yard run two
runners.spotlight: Consistent at two without really kicking on from her Windsor win last July (second start; 6f, good to firm); Billy Loughnane back on board for the first time since that success and well drawn for a prominent racer; absent since October; stable also run Queue Dos.

quotes.race: EBF Fillies' Restricted Novice Stakes (Bands C-D) (EBF Restricted Race Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Fleetwater was tough towards the line. Her experience definitely benefited her and she won well. She was still a bit raw and she'll keep on learning as she goes up through the grades. Six [furlongs] will be the bottom end of her trip as well - Billy Loughnane, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She'll probably run within the next fortnight. With all trainers, not just me, the weather's played havoc. You'd have days when you thought, this is nice, the heat's coming, and then the next day it's like the middle of winter. It's played havoc with their routine and their coming in their coats. It's been a bit of a nightmare year with two-year-olds. 04-07-24

runners.name: Brightwalton
runners.comment: Absent since flopping when odds-on at Chepstow last September; potential from opening mark
runners.spotlight: Absent since a lacklustre run when odds-on favourite at Chepstow last September (5f, good); her earlier efforts were encouraging though and she makes her handicap debut at a realistic level.

runners.name: Spirited Dancer
runners.comment: Promising early 2yo, including a good run here; ended 2024 quietly though; new yard/hood
runners.spotlight: Came to hand early as a 2yo for Jack Channon, second here on debut (5f) one year ago and winning easily at Bath last May (5.5f, good); ended the year quietly though and returns for a new yard (same owner) with a point to prove; hood replaces cheekpieces.

quotes.race: Daily Price Boosts At Yeeehaaa.Bet British EBF Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C/D) (Qual') (GBB)
quotes.quote: Spirited Dancer showed a lot of promise at Kempton but it was a non-event when she was unbalanced here next time. Jack and the team have been happy with her at home and I came here expecting a big run. She delivered - Eddie Greatrex, jockey, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: She won her maiden at Bath in May. She ran in the big sales race won by The Dragon King at Newmarket on Saturday, finishing down the field. She's a sweet filly who does everything well. 10-10-24

runners.name: Spiritualism
runners.comment: C&D win off this mark on her nursery debut in October; not so good in two runs this year
runners.spotlight: All-the-way C&D success on her nursery debut last October; runs off the same mark today but she's been well beaten in two runs this year and others look to bring greater potential.

runners.name: Foro Romano
runners.comment: Runner-up in C&D handicaps twice this year; up in the weights but should go well again
runners.spotlight: Eight-race maiden but he has finished second in C&D handicaps twice this year; edging up the weights but would appear more likely to give his running than many.

runners.name: Equalised
runners.comment: Only worthwhile form came over C&D last June (only AW run); gelded since last seen; chance
runners.spotlight: Four runs as a 2yo, showing his only worthwhile form when fourth over C&D (sole AW start) last June; the three to beat him there currently boast BHA ratings of 105, 99 and 85 so if a gelding operation has worked the oracle he has some potential off a lowly mark this year; interesting.

stable_tour.quote: The form of his first two races is strong but he wants better ground than he's had the last twice. He broke slowly from a terrible draw at Chester last time and you can put a line through that. He's rated 71 and should be competitive off that. He could go to Goodwood on Friday. 02-08-24

runners.name: Dream Out Loud
runners.comment: Similar fair form in three minor AW runs this year; can do better now handicapping
runners.spotlight: In the frame in three minor AW events this year, most recently caught wide at Chelmsford 19 days ago; brings untapped potential to this handicap debut.

runners.name: Drumstick

prev_owners.owner: HM The King & HM The Queen

runners.comment: Maiden; late headway into 4th over C&D in November; off since disappointing in January
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced maiden who proved suited by this C&D when coming from well back to take a late fourth of 12 in November (Calanthe just ahead and slightly better off at the weights); not seen since disappointing as favourite here in January but he retains potential.

runners.name: Norflondonforever
runners.comment: Lightly raced; shown promise at about 1m on AW and turf; can improve; now tongue tied
runners.spotlight: Belated debut in December before a promising Wolverhampton AW run (about 1m) in January; was not disgraced despite the 7l defeat on recent handicap debut at Leicester (1m) behind a Varian improver and the door is still open for improvement; down 3lb and now tongue tied.

runners.name: Racing Demon
runners.comment: 0-5 on AW but has twice run well over C&D and just 1lb higher than turf win in September
runners.spotlight: All five wins on turf, three over 1m in 2024; 0-5 on AW but he's run well twice over C&D and ought to have another good run in him back from a break off just 1lb higher than his latest win in September.

runners.name: Calanthe
runners.comment: Winning handicap debut on AW; several good efforts in defeat since; major factor again
runners.spotlight: Often leads; winless since successful handicap debut on Lingfield AW (1m) in September but he's run several good races in defeat over the winter and did so again back on turf at Doncaster recently; solid contender.

runners.name: Pride Of Nepal
runners.comment: Two turf wins in amateur jockeys' races in 2024; 0-11 on AW; likely of more interest later
runners.spotlight: Had a good spell in amateur jockeys' races for this yard late last summer, winning at Goodwood (1m1f) and Brighton (1m4f); he acts on Polytrack too but is 0-11 on AW and goes without the cheekpieces worn for his latest three wins.

quotes.race: Ring20 Better Lives With Epilepsy Amateur Jockeys' Handicap
quotes.quote: Pride Of Nepal just seems to be in great form. He's been running thereabouts and was able to win last week. He takes his racing ever so well, and by the end of last week he was bouncing again. He's so straightforward, a jockey's dream. He's a pleasure to do everything with. There's a lot of amateur races out there and the next port of call will be the Cambridgeshire. The stiff mile [and] one [furlong] would probably suit him, and he won over that trip at Goodwood. That win should put us up a few pounds so he should get in - Sarah Bowen, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Ectocross
runners.comment: All three wins at 1m2f, on AW and turf in 2023; three heavy defeats in 2024; best watched
runners.spotlight: All three wins at 1m2f, on Lingfield Polytrack and turf in 2023; suffered three heavy defeats in 2024 and has lots to find back from a break.

runners.name: Luna Dipinta
runners.comment: Not gone on from debut and soundly beaten on handicap debut over C&D in August
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 5yo who shaped nicely on 3yo debut but hasn't gone on and was soundly beaten on handicap debut over C&D last August (hood refitted with cheekpieces; latter now discarded); plenty to prove for now.

runners.name: The Spotlight Kid
runners.comment: In good form on AW over the winter, winning twice here (7f and 1m); back from short break
runners.spotlight: Perhaps ready for a break and drawn wide in late February when last seen but he had a good winter on the AW, winning twice on this course (7f and 1m); regular rider Luke Morris returns to Calanthe but Saffie Osborne is a good replacement; has more going for him than many.

runners.name: Bluebottle Blue
runners.comment: Weighted to go well on best 1m AW form; well held in 2 starts for this yard after absence
runners.spotlight: Lost out late in a 1m Tapeta handicap for William Haggas last January but she hasn't achieved much in two starts for this yard following nearly a year off the track; one to watch for now.

runners.name: Taskheer
runners.comment: Latest AW win was at classified level (1m) in February; vulnerable in handicaps since
runners.spotlight: Three AW wins at 1m on Polytrack elsewhere, most recently at classified level in February; vulnerable in handicaps since, though, and the refitting of a hood needs to make a difference.

quotes.race: Follow At The Races On Twitter Handicap
quotes.quote: Taskeer stays a mile so the strong pace here suited him. He tries very hard and the sharp track at Lingfield last time got him beat - Kieran Shoemark, jockey.

runners.name: First Conquest
runners.comment: Incurs 3lb penalty for Meydan G3 win but may progress further; 2-3 at Newmarket tracks
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 4yo who is 2-3 at the Newmarket tracks and 3-4 since wearing a hood; campaigned at Meydan this year, unsuited by steady pace when beaten favourite in Group 2 most recently; incurs 3lb penalty for Group 3 success the time before but may still have further progress in him.

quotes.race: Lord North Handicap Sponsored By DP World (Handicap) (Turf)
quotes.quote: First Conquest broke OK but wasn't fast enough to get up with the pace, so we took our time and the rhythm was OK. He was very good once he got a clear run. He's still an immature horse, but he did everything well today - Mickael Barzalona, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Mile Handicap
quotes.quote: First Conquest may be a horse that we take out for the Dubai Carnival. We'll have to see if we give him another run beforehand - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: bet365 Wood Ditton Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: First Conquest knew his job and it could be that he's a mile and a quarter horse going forward. He looks a handicap prospect and we used to have to pitch them into the deep end after this but changes to the programme book means we have other options - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

runners.name: Ambiente Friendly
runners.breeder: Al Shira'Aa Farms S A R L
runners.comment: Derby runner-up for James Fanshawe; commands respect at this level on debut for new yard
runners.spotlight: Formerly trained by James Fanshawe (remains in same ownership); strong traveller who was impressive in the Lingfield trial then ran well behind City Of Troy in last year's Derby; no further progress subsequently and was disappointing in French race on final outing; however, commands respect on peak figures and gives the impression this drop back in trip is well worth exploring.

quotes.race: Dubai Duty Free Irish Derby (Group 1) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Friendly travelled really well to the two pole and just got outstayed in the last furlong. The winner and the second are both very good horses. I still think we'll probably be dropping back in trip next time - James Fanshawe, trainer.

quotes.race: Betfred Derby (Group 1) (British Champions Series) (No Geldings)
quotes.quote: I'm really thrilled with his run. Ambiente Friendly did absolutely nothing wrong. I thought coming to the two-furlong pole we had a real chance, and then obviously City Of Troy was back to his best, so we got beaten fair and square. No excuses, he ran a really good race and I'm delighted with him, and with the team back at home, who have done a great job. City Of Troy on his day is a very good horse, and so are we, but I hope there is more to come from him because he's still got a lot of maturing to do, so I'm looking forward to the rest of the season with him. He's taking his racing so much better now - he settled well today and stayed well, so there's a lot to look forward to - James Fanshawe, trainer.

quotes.race: William Hill Lingfield Derby Trial Stakes (Listed Race) (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: That was exceptional. I've been riding Ambiente Friendly in lots of his work and he had come on so much from his run at Newmarket. They were much quicker conditions here, which he was unproven on, but he handled it beautifully. I couldn't speak highly enough of him - that was excellent. It felt to me like a proper trial. There was a nice even gallop and we got racing on the turn in, but I can't believe how he split the field so comfortably - Callum Shepherd, jockey.

quotes.race: British EBF 40th Anniversary Newcomers Maiden Stakes (For horses which have never run) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Ambiente Friendly showed us a little bit of ability at home, but you never know until you get them on the track and I'm delighted for the Gredleys that he's looked as impressive as he did. He'll have really enjoyed that today. They haven't gone quick and Tom has got him relaxed and in a rhythm and he went through the gears. It's a field of newcomers so you don't know what you've come up against but he's done it in nice style and hopefully he'll be a horse to follow - Tom Fanshawe, trainer's son and assistant, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Cairo

prev_owners.owner: D Smith, Mrs J Magnier, M Tabor, Westerberg

runners.comment: Useful sort but is 0-8 for current yard; new headgear combination needs to help
runners.spotlight: Capable of very useful form but finished behind First Conquest in last two Meydan starts, taking record for current yard to 0-8 (was 3-11 for Aidan O'Brien); chance of ending the losing run partly depends on how well he responds to new headgear combination.

quotes.race: UAE Derby sponsored by Atlantis The Royal (Group 2) (Dirt)
quotes.quote: It was Cairo's first run on dirt and he just didn't enjoy himself - Ryan Moore, jockey.

quotes.race: Killavullan Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It was a nice even gallop from the word go which suited Cairo. He's a lovely horse physically and he's done everything right so far. He's in the Group 1 in France next weekend but that will probably come too soon - Chris Armstrong, stable representative.

quotes.race: Manguard Plus Irish EBF (C & G) Maiden
quotes.quote: Cairo could drop back to seven, he has that bit of class - Aidan O'Brien, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He was disappointing at Meydan, but we feel he just didn't face the kickback on the dirt. We are happy to forgive him the run. 06-04-23

runners.name: Lavender Hill Mob
runners.comment: Hurdle winner for current stable; faces a difficult task back on the Flat
runners.spotlight: Faces a difficult task on Flat form for previous yard and hasn't fully live up to expectations in juvenile hurdles for current stable, notwithstanding one win; connections have a markedly stronger chance with Ambiente Friendly.

stable_tour.quote: He's the biggest, the scopiest and the highest-rated of all the juveniles on the Flat, so we're really excited about him. He had a nice break after leaving Michael Bell's and he's been doing a lot of schooling since. We hope he's a Triumph Hurdle horse, so until he tells us otherwise we'll be aiming him that way. He's got to have that important first day of school out the way over hurdles first, so he'll be coming out in the next few weeks. He likes soft ground and we've got our eye on the Finale at Chepstow. 25-11-24

runners.name: Ottoman Fleet
runners.comment: Smart globetrotter; 4-5 at this course and has won this contest for the last two years
runners.spotlight: Smart globetrotter who is the winner of three US Graded races; finished fourth in UAE Group 1 on last appearance; record of 4-5 at this course features wins in this contest for the last two years (started favourite both times); holds very solid claims in his bid to become the first horse to land the Earl of Sefton three times.

quotes.race: Wise Dan Stakes (Grade 2) (4yo+) (Turf)
quotes.quote: We changed Ottoman Fleet's running style tonight by making all as we felt that he has become sharper with experience of North American racing. Flavien Prat was very pleased with the horse. On the evidence of what he has achieved today, he probably deserves to have a crack at a race like the G1 Fourstardave at Saratoga in August. We have Master Of The Seas pencilled in for that race too, but it's a handicap and Ottoman Fleet will receive a bit of weight. It's a possibility - Charlie Appleby, trainer, speaking to Godolphin's website.

quotes.race: bet365 Earl Of Sefton Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: Ottoman Fleet just took a bit of a tug but I thought there was going to be more pace on to be honest. He's been a very consistent horse and has run well in Dubai. Unfortunately, his last race was a bit disappointing but I think he was just getting the hang of Meydan again. Kieren Fallon rides him at home and said he is as well as I've ever felt him, so we came knowing that he was in good order and we know the track suits him. Now he has a penalty it makes him harder to place and we have a team in America, so there is a possibility he could go out there and join them - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Fort Marcy Stakes (Grade 2) (4yo+) (Inner Turf)
quotes.quote: I had an exceptional horse. The main thing was to have something to aim at - Ottoman Fleet is one of those horses who tends to idle when he gets there - and he is in such great form. Kieren Fallon rides him in work and he gave me all the pointers about him - Richard Mullen, jockey.

quotes.race: bet365 Earl Of Sefton Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: We came here confident that Ottoman Fleet was fit and well and conditions were there to suit. William did say that conditions out there did suit him. With a bit of ease in the ground he is a lot more confident on it. He just likes a target and William gave him a confident ride For whatever reason he enjoys it here. Whether it is the lack of travelling or if it is the undulations out there that help him along I don't know but he is pretty solid here. I'd not really thought beyond this as this was our target. To be fair to the horse the ground will be going the opposite way in the foreseeable future so it would do no harm to give him a bit of break which he has well deserved - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: National Stud Welcomes Stradivarius James Seymour Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Ottoman Fleet is a horse that will probably make his way out to Dubai now and be part of that team. I think a mile and a quarter is his trip but it wouldn't worry me coming back to a stiff mile in these conditions. He should handle these conditions as he's a Sea The Stars out of a Motivator mare so he should like a bit of juice in the ground really. We'll work back from something like the Dubai Millennium with him. He has that Listed penalty around his neck and that is a Group Three over a mile and a quarter so that will probably be his target - Charlie Appleby, trainer.

quotes.race: Denbury Homes Fairway Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Ottoman Fleet didn't get off to the greatest starts. He knuckled at the stalls and nearly went down but thankfully he found a leg and I was able to stay on him. It was quite straightforward after that really. He travelled into the race well. He probably found the ground quick enough but showed a good attitude - James Doyle, jockey

runners.name: Persica
runners.comment: Steadily progressive last term; looks interesting with AW reappearance under his belt
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive as a 3yo last season, winning two useful handicaps in the south and Ayr Listed event (all over 1m2f on turf); looks the type who could improve further this season and is interesting with reappearance (outstayed in 1m3f AW Group 3) under his belt.

quotes.race: LiveScore Bet Doonside Cup Stakes (Listed Race)
quotes.quote: Persica could have done it better and my hand was forced a little bit. I was going wide and I could see Jim Crowley going to have a dream run coming through, it forced me to go when I didn't really want to. He's lasted out to the line but I wonder how fully this horse stays a mile and a quarter. He doesn't lack speed. Maybe his optimum is actually coming back a furlong. He's a nice three-year-old and he'll make a nice 4yo - Sean Levey, jockey.

quotes.race: Hong Kong Jockey Club Lester Piggott Handicap
quotes.quote: Persica was drawn 11 which was always going to be hard. We always thought he was a very good horse and he's definitely upwardly mobile. He was able to do it his way today, which was a massive advantage. He's a bit fragile mentally. I didn't think it would suit him here with the crowd and atmosphere. He's a little inexperienced but I hope as he grows up he can turn into a Group horse - Richard Hannon, trainer.

quotes.race: Unibet More Extra Place Races Nursery Handicap
quotes.quote: Persica is quite big but has plenty of ability. He stuck his head out when the other horse came to him and I didn't have to get very serious. He wasn't getting beat. When you look at him you'd say he's a miler all day long. He's one for next year - Pat Dobbs, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He's a good-looking horse and has looked amazing all winter. He'll thrive when he gets a mile and a quarter and I was pleased with his seasonal reappearance at Kempton the other day. He's matured a lot and will hopefully be a very nice horse. 29-04-24

runners.name: Arabian Dusk
runners.comment: Very useful filly; Group 2 winner and ran well in the Cheveley Park; top on ratings
runners.spotlight: Very useful filly whose 2yo form featured three good performances over 6f at Newmarket (both tracks), notably a success in Group 2 race (good) and third in the Cheveley Park (soft); top on ratings upped in trip.

quotes.race: Duchess Of Cambridge Stakes (Sponsored By bet365) (Group 2) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: I'm not sure the Guineas will be the right trip for Arabian Dusk but she certainly wasn't stopping at the end of the race today - in fact she was looking for a bit of company and I think she would have gone again if she had been challenged in the last 50 yards. I think we'll stick to this trip for the moment and maybe look at the Lowther Stakes at York and Cheveley Park and see what we are like over the winter. The reality is she came here today as a maiden and now she has won that race we know she has a lot of ability with a great temperament. There is every reason to think she can keep advancing as the season progresses - Simon Crisford, joint-trainer.

runners.name: Biniorella Bay
runners.comment: Twice fourth at Group 3 level but needs improvement to land this prize
runners.spotlight: Reached a fairly useful standard in her turf attempts (7f) last term, winning on the July course here then twice finishing fourth at Group 3 level; however, needs improvement to land this prize.

runners.name: Cartwheel
runners.comment: AW scorer who is one of several runners who look open to further progress
runners.spotlight: Made all for a comfortable win at Kempton (7f, AW) six months ago, building on her Beverley (5f) effort; goes into deeper waters but is one of several runners who look open to further progress.

runners.name: Celestial Orbit
runners.comment: Listed win at Sandown last July took her form figures to 711; possibilities
runners.spotlight: Absent since bagging Listed honours at Sandown (7f, good) last July, taking form figures to 711; possibilities upped further in grade, provided the truncated 2yo campaign doesn't cause a halt in her progress.

quotes.race: European Bloodstock News EBF Star Stakes (Listed Race) (Fillies)
quotes.quote: We've always liked Celestial Orbit and were just hoping for a piece of the prize-money against some well-fancied horses so for her to win is great. She was an expensive yearling so we're pleased she's managed to pick up some black type. She's laid-back and only does enough in her work but the racing has switched her on and she's done well physically throughout the season. She saw the stiff seven furlongs out well and I think she'll continue to improve. One of the first things Jamie said when he came in is that she should improve over a mile but obviously there aren't many of those races for a bit. She's in the Group 2 Prix du Calvados in August, while the Prestige Stakes could be an option but we'll wait to see how she comes out of this - Ollie Sangster, trainer.

runners.name: Nardra
runners.comment: Powered clear at Haydock in sole 2yo start; fits into the could-be-anything category
runners.spotlight: Cost 440,000gns as a yearling; powered clear of three rivals at Haydock (6f, soft) in sole 2yo start, justifying favouritism; likely to be suited by 7f; fits into the could-be-anything category and looks interesting.

runners.name: Qarlyga
runners.comment: AW win flanks a couple of defeats; this looks a difficult task
runners.spotlight: Seemed to need the experience on debut and the outing on 2025 reappearance; successful at Newcastle (7f, AW) in between and may do better still; however, this looks a difficult task.

runners.name: Remaat
runners.comment: Absent since beating two rivals on the July course last June; market helpful
runners.spotlight: The runner who's had the longest time out, having been absent beating two rivals in July course maiden (7f, good to firm) last June; still unexposed but the betting may prove best guide to expectations.

quotes.race: Blandford Bloodstock Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Remaat has improved with every run and put her experience to good use out there. She feels as if this is the right trip for her at present - Oisin Murphy, trainer.

runners.name: Saguaro Blossom
runners.comment: Seems to have no chance, being clear bottom on bare figures
runners.spotlight: Showed ability with her fifth-place finish in 7f AW maiden at Lingfield and may do better in due course; however, seems to have no chance in this field, being clear bottom on bare figures.

runners.name: Verse Of Love
runners.comment: Ideal type for this race, having been impressive over C&D last autumn; good prospect
runners.spotlight: Siyouni filly who looks the ideal type for this race en route to bigger things, having impressively justified favouritism in C&D maiden (good to soft; won by 5l) last autumn; smart prospect who warrants respect.

runners.name: Zanzoun
runners.comment: This is harder than final 2yo assignment but she's well bred and retains potential
runners.spotlight: Comfortably justified favouritism at Southwell (7f, AW) in final 2yo run, albeit task was made easier by the withdrawal of her two nearest market rivals; this is harder but she's well bred and retains potential.

quotes.race: Safer Gambling Tools At BetMGM EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: She overraced slightly last time over the mile at Yarmouth and dropped back in trip today Zanzoun behaved in a very professional manner. She relaxed beautifully with no cover and she galloped all the way to the line. I'm sure she'll stay the mile again at some stage - Kieran Shoemark, jockey, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Almeric
runners.comment: Solid promise last autumn featured a win at York; should improve further; in the mix
runners.spotlight: Solid promise over 1m last autumn, finishing 2l fourth at Sandown (good) then scoring by 1l at York (soft); this half-brother to nine winners should be capable of further progress; in the mix.

quotes.race: Coral Racing Club EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was good. Almeric did well at Sandown on his debut and his pedigree suggests he's only going to get better as a three-year-old and on better ground too - P J McDonald, jockey.

runners.name: Green Storm
runners.comment: Ran well in Group 3 at Newmarket and Group 1 at Saint-Cloud the last twice; solid
runners.spotlight: Seems to handle any ground; consistent 2yo campaign ended with good efforts over 1m2f in Group 3 at Newmarket and Group 1 at Saint-Cloud, taking form figures to 322122; solid claims.

quotes.race: Get Raceday Ready Restricted Maiden Stakes (Bands C And D) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Green Storm is in the Criterium de Saint-Cloud which we won a few years ago for the owner with Dubai Mile. He could go there or something like the Zetland Stakes at Newmarket - Charlie Johnston, trainer.

runners.name: King Of Cities
runners.comment: From a good family that has served his owner-breeder well; should do better still
runners.spotlight: Showed consistent form (7f/1m) last term, with Chester success flanked by two sound efforts; should still have more to offer, being from a good family that has served his owner-breeder well.

runners.name: Last Galileo
runners.comment: Neck win at Ayr in last appearance; this is a difficult task on bare figures
runners.spotlight: Galileo colt whose 2yo form comprised a second-place finish at Redcar (7f) and neck win at Ayr (1m, good); may do better still but this looks a difficult task on bare figures.

stable_tour.quote: I think he's going to want a mile and a quarter-plus but he'll probably start off next week in the Feilden Stakes over 1m1f, which on a galloping track like Newmarket might just play to his strengths. He's quite lazy, which makes him hard to assess but I think he's got a lot of potential up to a certain level. 11-04-25

runners.name: Law Of Design
runners.comment: Came up well short in the Royal Lodge at this track; needs improvement
runners.spotlight: Beat three rivals at Ascot (7f, soft) on second start, then came up well short in the Royal Lodge here (1m) later in September; needs to find improvement upped further in distance.

quotes.race: tote.co.uk British EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: That was great. I'm delighted with Law Of Design. He's always shown a lot at home and is a big horse so we'll take stock and decide next week what the next step is. I thought this might be a week too soon, but the ground attracted me and he worked really well this week so I thought we'd get on with it. He's a proper horse I'd say - Brian Meehan, trainer, talking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Masai Moon
runners.comment: Well-bred colt who won at Kempton in sole 2yo run; top yard; brings major potential
runners.spotlight: Well-bred colt, by Siyouni and from the family of Galileo; justified short odds at Kempton (1m, AW) in sole 2yo run; represents powerful stable and brings major potential to this higher grade.

quotes.race: Unibet Zero% Mission/EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race) (Div II)
quotes.quote: It's a learning curve, so he should learn plenty. Once the penny dropped Masai Moon really picked up well. It was a nice performance and he's a horse who is going to progress lovely into next year - William Buick, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

runners.name: Nightwalker
runners.comment: Form of his Autumn Stakes effort has been advertised by the winner since; respected
runners.spotlight: Frankel colt who ran well in the Autumn Stakes here (1m, good to soft) on final 2yo start for Sir Michael Stoute; winner has advertised that form since; respected with further progress plausible.

runners.name: Sallaal
runners.comment: Got up close home at Yarmouth; superbly bred and open to any amount of progress
runners.spotlight: Frankel half-brother to two Group 1 winners; got up close home at Yarmouth (7f, soft) six months ago and, given his pedigree, looks open to any amount of improvement this year; interesting.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sallaal has been a true professional. The only time he wasn't was when they quickened and he couldn't find his legs, but he dealt with it quite well. He showed a bit of class - Jack Mitchell, rider.

stable_tour.quote: There's a lot to like about him. He took all last year to strengthen and wasn't the finished article by a long way when he went to Yarmouth, so I was delighted that he won. He carries all the big entries and is a half-brother to Elmalka and Benbatl, so he's got a bit to live up to. Time will tell if he can match their ability but I think he's quite smart. He's almost ready to run and his first run will tell us a whole lot more. 11-04-25

runners.name: Woodhay Wonder
runners.comment: 3-3 over C&D, including a win at this meeting on her return in 2024; should go well
runners.spotlight: Tough 2yo; bright start to her 3yo campaign, winning at this meeting before adding another C&D success one month later; ran fine races in defeat in two hot 5f handicaps at Ascot afterwards before turning in a rare disappointing effort at Ayr's Western meeting (Listed race; sent off favourite); 3-3 on the Rowley course and can go well fresh; should go well.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap
quotes.quote: Tom Ward said Woodhay Wonder hadn't been showing much at home but Tom Marquand said she just went like the wind. She has black type from last year but we'll look to win a Listed race with her this year. The Ellen Chaloner Stakes on 2,000 Guineas day looks an obvious race - Matt Coleman, owners' spokesman.

quotes.race: £150,000 Tattersalls October Auction Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: After Woodhay Wonder's last start we were quite keen to give her a bit more time and come here. She has been so well at home, and I was coming here more confident than I was last time. She just gets a bit fresh behind the stalls and we will have to work on that, but as long as that is the only thing we have to do that is not a problem. She looks to me like she will go seven (furlongs) and possibly a mile a next year which is quite an exciting prospect. She has got enough size and scope about her that she is not just a two-year-old. I don't think we will come out again at this stage. I think she is definitely a filly for next season. We could go to Newbury for the Fred Darling. If she does strengthen as I hope over the winter then it would be great race to go for - Tom Ward, trainer.

quotes.race: £100,000 Tattersalls Somerville Auction Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: The Dick Poole at Salisbury in two weeks, if it doesn't come too soon, we could look at, but there are plenty of races at the end of the season for Woodhay Wonder. Being on that slower ground today would suggest she is versatile regarding the ground. She is tough and hardy. PJ got on her and he said she felt like a colt. She's a big girl and there's no reason why she won't train on next year so we have some options - Tom Ward, trainer.

runners.name: Elmonjed
runners.comment: Ended 3yo campaign with two big-field 6f wins on fast ground; absence of blinkers a query
runners.spotlight: Promising when winning both his 2yo starts; proved expensive to follow in his early races last year but he was fitted with blinkers prior to winning at Windsor in August and he followed that up by seeing off 18 rivals in a hot race at York's Ebor meeting; surprising if there isn't more to come from him this year but the absence of headgear is a slight concern; stable also represented by More Thunder.

quotes.race: Sky Bet Constantine Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: The horse is tough since he's had the headgear put on him. Elmonjed was idling without it and needed it to make him concentrate. He hits flat spots in his races and it wouldn't amaze me if he got further one day. It's very much one step at a time with him, but he could be good enough for a bigger prize in time - Angus Gold, racing manager to Shadwell Estates.

quotes.race: AC Plastics Limited EBF Novice Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: It looked like the runner-up had got away from him a bit so Elmonjed did well to win under a penalty and I really liked how he put his head down in the final furlong. He surprised us a little at Lingfield and has really improved from his debut. He was gelded in the summer because he was misbehaving but he's a good-looking horse and progressing with time. He's entered at Chantilly next Saturday and that's a pretty quick turnaround, but we'll talk with Sheikha Hissa and William [Haggas] and make a plan. He's going in the right direction and is a really nice horse - Richard Hills, assistant racing manager for owners Shadwell.

quotes.race: British Stallion Studs EBF Maiden Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Shadwell have another nice horse on their hands. Elmonjed has done well to overcome that greeness early on what is a sharp track - Tom Marquand, jockey speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

runners.name: Indian Run
runners.comment: Smart 2yo; struggled badly in 2024; sold 40,000gns & gelded; new yard drop him back to 6f
runners.spotlight: Group 3 win as a 2yo (7f, good to firm); struggled badly last year but he wouldn't be the first horse with his profile to rediscover his touch as a 4yo; sold out of Eve Johnson Houghton's for 40,000gns in October and gelded; new yard quick to return him to sprint trips and it will be interesting to see if there's any market support; owners also represented by Dark Thirty.

quotes.race: Tattersalls Acomb Stakes (Group 3)
quotes.quote: It's very exciting, I was really happy with Indian Run. He got a bad trip all the way round on the outside and didn't get any cover but he found and found, which is great. He's in the Dewhurst so we'll probably look there. He's so unfurnished he needs time so we'll give him a nice break - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

quotes.race: Greatwood Charity 25th Anniversary British EBF Crocker Bulteel Maiden Stakes (Colts & Geldings)
quotes.quote: Indian Run is very unfurnished and was quite colty in the paddock, so did pretty much everything wrong before the race, but he did everything right in it. It looked a nice race and Danny said it rode like a nice race. We've thought quite a bit of him for a while and he's not entered in any posh races, but probably will be soon - Eve Johnson Houghton, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He made a very promising debut at Newbury last week over 6f. I was very happy with that as he ran on for third place in what was probably a decent novice. I thought he would run well but he should come on nicely for that experience and looks up to winning a maiden sooner rather than later. 11-07-23

runners.name: Vantheman
runners.comment: Two wins & some good runs in defeat last year, all at 5f; stays 6f; one to take seriously
runners.spotlight: 6f win as a 2yo; raced only at 5f last year, winning handicaps at Newcastle (reappearance) and Pontefract and finishing a fine second at York's Dante meeting; still has few miles on the clock and he's one to consider.

runners.name: Aramram
runners.comment: Two fine efforts in defeat on AW this year; well treated; major player once again
runners.spotlight: Progressed well in the second half of 2024 and he's a shade unfortunate not to have won both starts this year, finishing off well at Kempton last month and then picked off close home at Southwell nine days ago; fast turf no problem and he's a leading contender; yard also run Dark Thirty.

runners.name: First Folio
runners.comment: Retains a chunk of ability but perhaps a shade high in the weights for his return
runners.spotlight: Not as good as he was but he scored at Yarmouth in September (eyeshields first time) and wasn't beaten far off this mark at Southwell when last seen; stable also run Indian Run.

quotes.race: Pavers Foundation Catherine Memorial Sprint Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: I'm thrilled, this has been the plan since First Folio won at Yarmouth very impressively, with Newmarket on the way. The faster ground definitely helped him out today and we made sure we got him out of the stalls. Credit to Dan, he gave him a very cool ride - James Ferguson, trainer.  This horse probably lacked a bit of experience in a big field last time and I wasn't disappointed with the way he went through the race - his finishing position didn't reflect how well he ran - Daniel Muscutt, jockey.

stable_tour.quote: He is a lovely horse and something of a stable stalwart with three wins under his belt. Although he is consistent he is also still progressive and will run at Kempton on Wednesday. I think he can prove he is able to compete in big handicaps at the top level. I would love to have him teed up for a Wokingham or something of that ilk. He has a lot of faith and stiff 6f races suit him perfectly, but he stays 7f and later this year he could get possibly get even further. 29-03-23

runners.name: Dark Thirty
runners.comment: Won this race last year off 4lb higher; game effort to win at Doncaster latest; contender
runners.spotlight: Always on the pace when winning the corresponding race 12 months ago off a 4lb higher mark; gelded prior to this year's reappearance and he showed plenty of pluck in seeing off 18 rivals at Doncaster (6f, good); 3lb rise shouldn't prevent another big run.

quotes.race: Weatherbys Global Stallions App Handicap
quotes.quote: Dark Thirty was always going to be a nice horse this year mentally more than anything and he did that well. He could be a fun Saturday horse - Sean Levey, jockey.

quotes.race: Bet With JenningsBet Handicap
quotes.quote: Dark Thirty likes it here and that shower we had helped him. He's a consistent type - Sam Hitchcott, jockey.

quotes.race: Conundrum HR Consulting Handicap
quotes.quote: I was confident seven furlongs was going to be best for Dark Thirty. He was a bit of a handful last time at Newmarket over a mile but he settled better today. I was pleased as he stuck on really well - Sean Levey, jockey.

quotes.race: Starlight Isla And Bella Maiden Stakes (GBB Race) (IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: Dark Thirty only does enough, but I'm not surprised - he's a very nice horse. He works okay, like a lot of good ones, and this fella will be better when he goes further and he'll improve nicely for that. You have to think about Royal Ascot with any juvenile who wins at this time of year, but he's a very nice horse for the rest of the season and if that doesn't include Ascot, that's fine. That will switch him on a lot because he's not a zippy two-year-old; he's a grinder with a lovely attitude - Richard Hannon, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He won well the other day at Newmarket and could turn into a nice Stewards' Cup horse, while a race like the Wokingham should suit him. He goes on any ground. 29-04-24

runners.name: Trefor
runners.owner: Julie Martin & David R Martin & Partner
runners.comment: Second to Woodhay Wonder here last year; conditions will suit and still not fully exposed
runners.spotlight: Chased home Woodhay Wonder in the 3yo handicap at this meeting 12 months ago; made good progress thereafter, winning at Windsor and the July course in June (both 6f on good to firm) before rounding off his season with a close fifth behind Elmonjed back at Windsor in August; he will need to progress again to take this but conditions will suit and he's only had ten runs so it's plausible.

quotes.race: Packhorse Moulton Supports Racing Welfare Handicap
quotes.quote: Trefor is an improving horse who enjoyed the quick ground - Rab Havlin, rider.

runners.name: Probe
runners.comment: Strong C&D form; retains ability after long absence; slower ground perhaps ideal though
runners.spotlight: Second in this race in 2023 before winning the big sprint handicap at the Guineas meeting so the course will hold no fears; unplaced in both runs back from a long absence this year but both have offered encouragement; becoming well treated but suspicion he would prefer slower ground.

quotes.race: Howden Handicap (Heritage Handicap)
quotes.quote: Probe is a straightforward horse and Jennie's done a great job getting his head right. We learnt the last time here that we probably got there a bit soon. We waited a bit longer today and the rain has helped. I'm really pleased as he's a proper horse - Alan O'Keeffe, assistant trainer.

quotes.race: Remembering John Kierans Rated Race
quotes.quote: Probe is progressing. The step up to a mile suited him last day and he has sharpened up since. He handles the ease well and I think he's versatile as to trip, I think he could get as far as 1m2f - Colin Keane, rider

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF (C & G) Maiden (Plus 10 Race)
quotes.quote: I rode Probe on debut when he was plenty green and raw and I loved him. Oisin (Orr) said he was plenty green again the second day and said he'd appreciate going that little bit further and the step up to a mile with juice in the ground suited. It probably wasn't the strongest race but you'd like the way he did it and hopefully he can keep improving. I wouldn't think he's too far off Stakes level - Colin Keane, rider.

stable_tour.quote: He's a proper good sprinter on his day. He was a great servant for us in 2023 when he won the big sprint handicap on Guineas day at Newmarket. He's had a few setbacks but is on the way back and we'll be looking to start off again in January for the big all-weather handicaps. 05-12-24

runners.name: More Thunder
runners.breeder: Woodstock B/S Ltd & Troy Bloodstock Ltd
runners.comment: Unexposed 4yo but all runs for former yard over 1m1f+; dam a smart sprinter; intriguing
runners.spotlight: Showed a useful level of ability in his first season of racing for Sir Michael Stoute, winning a 1m2f novice at Nottingham last May and in the money in his next three starts (including both handicaps); still has considerable potential and intriguing that he's being dropped markedly in trip by his new trainer (dam a 6f Listed winner); market useful in relation to stablemate Elmonjed.

runners.name: Physique
runners.comment: Promising stable debut at Doncaster 16 days ago; possible slower ground would suit better
runners.spotlight: Eyecatching debut for Pam Sly when fourth to Dark Thirty at Doncaster 16 days ago (6f, good), doing best of the stands' side group; has the ability to feature off a good mark but he isn't straightforward (often races too freely) and possible he would prefer slower ground too.

quotes.race: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Ahonoora Handicap (Premier Handicap)
quotes.quote: Physique is a horse who likes to get on with things and there is only one way to ride him. He can get quite wound up if you try to hold him back. Seamie knows him and knew what to do after riding him the last couple of times - Micky Fenton, trainer.

runners.name: Ararat
runners.comment: Poor draw when down the field on last month's stable debut; all wins at 7f; others safer
