runners.spotlight: Drawn wide when making an underwhelming stable debut at Kempton 17 days ago (behind Aramram); all wins at 7f; others appeal more.

quotes.race: Turners Handicap
quotes.quote: Ararat is a talented horse who has underachieved but he's capable on his day - David Simcock, trainer

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap
quotes.quote: Ararat has promised to win in the past so it was nice he could get his head in front. We've tried him on soft ground as he's German-bred, but he likes it quicker-Bruce Raymond, owner's racing manager.

stable_tour.quote: He's been an underachiever. He's always been talented but lets us down more times than not. He looked very good and produced a very good time figure at Chelmsford. That was a nice prize. We'll look to run him on fast ground or on the all-weather between now and the end of the season. He's entered at Ascot on Friday, a seven-furlong classified race, so he might go there. 04-09-24

runners.name: Twilight Romance
runners.comment: In better order than his formfigures suggest; returning to fast turf can help; hood off
runners.spotlight: Yet to win a handicap but he's slipped to a dangerous mark and continues to leave the impression a bigger run could be forthcoming; promising on fast turf as a 2yo and the removal of the hood he has been sporting could help; one to consider.

quotes.race: Reg Griffin Appreciation ebfstallions.com Maiden Stakes (GBB/IRE Incentive Race)
quotes.quote: The Haydock race Twilight Romance ran in worked out well. He looked a little bit green there and still looked as though he would improve further today. We'll probably work back from the 300,000GBP sales race here in August - Sean Quinn, assistant trainer.

stable_tour.quote: I like him. He ran very well in a good race at Haydock first time out last year, then won impressively at York. He was third favourite for the sales race at the Ebor meeting but got very upset in the preliminaries and had run his race before the stalls opened. We decided to geld him and put him away and I wouldn't be surprised if he built on that York win this year. He's one for the good three-year-old sprint handicaps. 20-03-24

5:20.race_name: Each Way Extra At bet365 Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.name: Treasure Fleet
runners.comment: 800,000gns breeze-up purchase; successful in two races in January; commands respect
runners.spotlight: Bought for 800,000gns at the breeze-ups here a year ago; justified favouritism in two novice events at Wolverhampton (8.5f, AW) in January, shaping as if he'll be suited by this extra yardage; respected with further progress on the cards.

runners.name: Brindavan
runners.comment: Record is 1-8 but he's consistent; however, looks the most exposed contender
runners.spotlight: Record is just 1-8 but he's consistent; gelded prior to creditable second at Kempton (1m, AW) on seasonal debut; likely to stay this new trip if taking after his dam; however, looks the most exposed contender.

runners.name: The Trickster
runners.comment: 150,000euros breeze-up buy; two from two and looks a useful middle-distance prospect
runners.spotlight: Late foal; 150,000euros breeze-up buy; edged ahead near the finish in novice events at Beverley (8.5f, good) and Redcar (1m1f, soft) last autumn; looks a useful middle-distance prospect and the type to do well in handicaps; interesting.

quotes.race: EBF "Double Trigger" Novice Stakes (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: We didn't race The Trickster through the summer as we felt he needed a bit of time. He battled well at Beverley from an outside draw, and today he put his head down again. He should make into a nice staying horse - John Quinn, joint-trainer, speaking on Racing TV.

runners.name: Lady Chartwell
runners.comment: Opened her account in AW event on handicap/seasonal debut; may improve further
runners.spotlight: Opened her account in Class 5 contest at Chelmsford (1m2f, AW) on handicap/seasonal debut; now 6lb higher and upped a couple of grades but may well build on that success and progress further; not dismissed.

runners.name: Hallelujah U
runners.comment: Rallied to win final 2yo start; goes handicapping with further progress plausible
runners.spotlight: Progressive autumn form culminated in 1m AW success at Southwell where he rallied and shaped as if this longer trip should be within range; goes handicapping with further improvement plausible; possibilities.

4:10.race_name: Bet Boost At bet365 EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Guernsey Lady
runners.comment: 5,000gns foal; by Coulsty out of a modest winner; the least appealing contender
runners.spotlight: 5,000gns foal; Coulsty half-sister to German 7.7f winner Conde, out of 6f 2yo/1m AW winner (RPR 60) whose siblings include group-placed (7f) Pimento; the least appealing contender.

runners.name: Harrys Girl
runners.comment: £36,000 yearling; by Harry Angel; major yard won this race in 2014 and 2022; possibilities
runners.spotlight: £36,000 yearling; by Harry Angel and the first foal of an unraced half-sister to KSA 1m Listed winner Uncle (by Harry Angel) and daughter of half-sister to 6f 2yo Group 3 winner Prolific; major yard won this race in 2014 and 2022; possibilities.

runners.name: Meelaf
runners.comment: 105,000gns yearling; by Iffraaj; major yard; the biggest eyecatcher in terms of price-tag
runners.spotlight: 22,000gns foal, 105,000gns yearling; by Iffraaj and the first foal of a twice-raced (RPR 50) half-sister to useful 5f/6f (including 2yo) winner Pennsylvania Dutch; the biggest eyecatcher in terms of price-tag; major stable; one for the shortlist.

runners.name: Naanas Shadow
runners.comment: £27,000 yearling; by Havana Grey; stable has a respectable record with 2yos
runners.spotlight: £27,000 yearling; Havana Grey half-sister to three winners, notably Cavalier Approach (5f/6f; RPR 80) and Sun Rising (7.4f 2yo; 56); dam 5f/6f winner (87); yard has a respectable record with 2yos.

runners.name: Rubys Angel
runners.comment: 40,000gns yearling; attractively bred and represents last year's winning yard; interesting
runners.spotlight: 40,000gns yearling; by first-season sire Starman; half-sister to winners Glorious Angel (5f-7f including 2yo; RPR 96) and Devious Angel (5f 2yo; 90), out of Listed-placed 5f 2yo winner (86); attractively bred and represents last year's winning stable; interesting.

runners.name: Storm Flag
runners.comment: 35,000euros yearling; by Starspangledbanner; major stable; heed the market signals
runners.spotlight: 35,000euros yearling; by Starspangledbanner and the first foal of a maiden (RPR 63) sibling to 1m4f/2m Group 3 winner Nayef Road and daughter of 6f/7f Listed winner; major yard; heed the market signals.

runners.name: Twilight Star
runners.comment: Likely type on breeding; powerful stable won this contest in 2018 and 2019; respected
runners.spotlight: Mehmas filly; dam 5f/6f winner (including 2yo; RPR 95), half-sister to winners Tone The Barone (prolific 5f/6f) and Mrs Gallagher (5f/5.5f Listed), out of Listed-placed 6f winner; powerful stable won this contest in 2018 and 2019; likely type on breeding; respected.

4:45.race_name: bet365 British EBF Maiden Fillies' Stakes (GBB Race)

runners.name: Goldie Trickett
runners.comment: 1,650,000euros yearling; sister to Group 1 winner Saffron Beach; very interesting
runners.spotlight: 1,650,000euros yearling; sister to winners Saffron Beach (7f/1m including Group 1; RPR 121) and Granger Bay (7f; 99), out of 7f AW 2yo winner (82); major stable; very interesting newcomer.

runners.name: Mahogany Bay
runners.owner: Mrs M V Magnier & S E Sangster
runners.comment: Always behind in 7f maiden on the July course in sole 2yo start
runners.spotlight: Always behind in quite a useful 7f maiden on the July course here in sole 2yo start; others have stronger claims on bare figures but she may improve this term.

runners.name: Model Yuko
runners.comment: Closely related to a Flat/hurdle winner, half-sister to two winners; market helpful
runners.spotlight: Closely related to 1m-1m2f Flat (RPR 94)/2m hurdle winner Postmark, half-sister to two winners, notably Bipartisanship (US 1m/8.5f turf including Listed; 104); check the betting.

runners.name: Naga
runners.comment: Dubawi filly whose 7f/1m2f efforts suggest this 1m trip may prove her optimum
runners.spotlight: Dubawi filly who has shown ability over 7f/1m2f while shaping as if this 1m trip may prove her optimum; hung left both times but greenness has possibly played a part; remains open to progress.

runners.name: Pelean
runners.comment: Useful pedigree; duly showed promise (close second) at Southwell; major player
runners.spotlight: Useful pedigree, being by Pinatubo out of a Listed winner for her owners; duly showed promise (close second) in 1m AW contest at Southwell and has potential; one of the main contenders.

runners.name: Treasured Angel
runners.breeder: Kirtlington Park, A Davis & E Foster
runners.comment: 18,000gns; half-sister to five winners; this looks a stiff introduction
runners.spotlight: 18,000gns yearling; Sergei Prokofiev half-sister to five winners, notably California Gem (5f 2yo; RPR 90) and Cephalus (prolific 7f/1m AW; 91); this looks a stiff introduction.

runners.name: Victory Queen
runners.comment: Kingman half-sister to 2,000 Guineas winner Coroebus; respected debutante
runners.spotlight: Kingman half-sister to three winners, notably Coroebus (1m including 2,000 Guineas; RPR 123); dam 7f 2yo winner (including Group 3; 105), half-sister to 7f-1m2f Group 1 winner Thunder Snow; respected debutante.

runners.name: Zgharta
runners.comment: Showed ability at this course last backend; possibilities if taking well to hood
runners.spotlight: 105,000euros yearling; showed ability with her third-place finish at this course (7f, good to soft) last backend and that race has thrown up a couple of winners; possibilities if taking well to hood.

runners.name: Art Of Diplomacy

prev_owners.owner: Imperial Racing, J Blackburn & P Scott

runners.comment: Consistent over fences since December and drops in grade for this return to hurdling
runners.spotlight: Consistent over fences since returning from a break and seemed to respond well to first-time cheekpieces when creditable third in 0-130 contest at Newbury (2m7f, good to soft) last month; reverts to hurdling on same mark and with blinkers tried for the first time; respected.

runners.name: My Gift To You
runners.comment: Chase winner in the autumn and ran well over C&D when back over hurdles in December
runners.spotlight: Scored over fences in the autumn and a very respectable third off today's mark over C&D (good to soft) when back over hurdles in December; has fitness to prove after four-month break but won't be far away if tuned up.

quotes.race: bet365 Handicap Chase (Go North Red Rum Series Qualifier)
quotes.quote: My Gift To You has never actually won like that [from that far out] before.  When we've tried to make all in his previous races he's overraced, and it's taken a while to get him to settle and into a rhythm.  We were going to sit behind until halfway today, but he's not a horse you can disappoint.  He's very versatile in terms of trip and going - Alex Chadwick, rider, speaking to Sky Sports Racing.

quotes.race: Sky Sports Racing Sky 415 Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle (Div II)
quotes.quote: My Gift To You is a great, lovely horse. He caught my eye at the sales and there were a couple of trainers after him because he's good-looking, but I wanted him when I started training because we could do a good job with him. He's improving and getting stronger. We probably rushed him in the summer trying to beat the handicapper and he needed time to develop - James Owen, trainer, speaking on Sky Sports Racing.

stable_tour.quote: He'd shown very little form when I bought him at Ascot sales for£8,000. He's a very good-looking, well-bred horse and he won his first start for us over hurdles, then won a chase the next start and came back from a little break to score again on his second start over fences. He's a big baby and very much a horse for the future. 06-12-23

runners.name: Stratton Oakmont
runners.comment: Looked back in much better nick when sixth at Newbury last month; on good mark now
runners.spotlight: Weakened quickly and was pulled up on consecutive outings during the winter but looked back in much better nick when respectable sixth at Newbury (3m, good to soft) last month; another 2lb lower here; contender if able to build on that recent effort.

runners.name: Jackpot Dathou
runners.comment: Disappointing 6yo; upped in trip and tried in first-time blinkers here
runners.spotlight: Regressive 6yo who was pulled up on last month's chasing debut and also disappointed when back over hurdles in refitted cheekpieces a fortnight ago; upped from 2m5f and tried in first-time blinkers here.

stable_tour.quote: Despite winning twice from four starts, his form over hurdles lacked consistency last season; he's a good workhorse at home but we haven't yet seen him reproduce it on the track. We fancied him strongly when he finished last in a handicap up at Ayr on his final start, and to this day I haven't the faintest idea why he ran so badly. His wind wasn't great, so we've had that tweaked over the summer. His mark of 121 is one I think we can win off. 04-11-24

runners.name: Zacony Rebel
runners.comment: Well beaten on both outings this year and has a lot more to prove than some of these
runners.spotlight: Gave good account when fifth at Ludlow (2m5f, good to soft) in December, his second stable start, but well beaten on both appearances this year and has a lot more to prove than some of these.

runners.name: Caher Roes Den
runners.comment: Weakened quickly on latest outing but was a clear third on handicap debut two starts ago
runners.spotlight: Weakened quickly in closing stages at Market Rasen in January and needs to prove his wellbeing  but he posted a good effort when clear third on handicap debut at Wincanton (3m, good) in October and is 1lb lower now; big player if back on song.

stable_tour.quote: He has some decent Irish point-to-point form, finishing fourth to Tullyhill before winning on his second start, and is just starting back after knocking himself about a month ago. He'll start off over hurdles and a stiff finish over two and a half miles will suit him. He'll end up over two miles five furlongs to three miles and he's a nice type. He's shown some good qualities and jumps very well. 30-11-23

runners.name: Uokhun
runners.comment: Off the mark at Hexham last month; not beaten far in a competitive series final next time
runners.spotlight: Battled well to open account at Hexham (2m7f, good to soft) last month, her tenth hurdling start, and not beaten far when seventh in a competitive series final at Musselburgh (3m, good to soft) a week later; 5lb higher now but still considered.

runners.name: Rare Clouds
runners.comment: Off since poor run in December but makes stable debut from a workable mark; not ruled out
runners.spotlight: Landed good prize at Wincanton (2m5f, heavy) in early 2024 and also has a good-ground course win on his CV; signed off for Simon Earle with poor run in December but makes stable debut from a workable mark; not ruled out.

runners.name: For Gina
runners.owner: Louise Kemble And J J W Wadham
runners.comment: Close third of five at Fakenham recently and still well handicapped on last spring's form
runners.spotlight: Not firing on all cylinders since returning in the autumn from a break but took step back in right direction when close third of five at Fakenham (2m7f, good) last month and remains well handicapped on last spring's form.

quotes.race: Payne Crop Nutrition Ltd Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: For Gina was great. I'd never ridden her before but I spoke to Tom [Cannon, jockey] and he filled me full of confidence that she was straightforward and not to complicate things. I wished someone had taken me into the race a bit more as the race fell apart after three out but she's done it nicely - Alex Chadwick, jockey, speaking to Racing TV.

quotes.race: Greene King Level Head Novices' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: There were a few in the field with big weights, which is difficult around here, and For Gina was very game and just outbattled them. She's as hard as nails and she made it easy for me - Bryony Frost, jockey.

runners.name: Ballela Blaze
runners.comment: Close second in modest race at Plumpton 12 days ago; others have more compelling form
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles; evidently well suited by step up in trip when keeping on well for close second at Plumpton (3m1f, good) 12 days ago but that modest race was won in a slow time and others in this line-up have much more compelling form.

3:15.race_name: Weekend Winners On Sky Sports Racing Novices' Hurdle (Novices' Championship Hdl Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.name: Serious Challenge
runners.comment: Very useful Flat racer who is 2-3 over hurdles this year; taken very seriously
runners.spotlight: Very useful on the Flat when based in Ireland and 2-3 over hurdles for Fergal O'Brien this year, having won at Plumpton (2m4f, soft) and Ayr (2m, heavy); might be seen to even better effect on the faster ground here and needs to be taken very seriously.

quotes.race: BoyleSports Casino Irish EBF Maiden
quotes.quote: Serious Challenge is a lovely horse. The run earlier in the week brought him forward a lot. He's in the Futurity at the Curragh so that's probably where he'll go next - Una Manning, assistant trainer.

runners.name: Sorceleur
runners.comment: Dual novice winner in the autumn; not beaten far in Imperial Cup last month; big player
runners.spotlight: Dual novice winner on good ground in the autumn (2m/1m7f) and consistent in defeat since; never looked dangerous when staying on from the rear for ninth in Imperial Cup at Sandown (2m, good to soft) last month but was beaten about only 5l in the end and has a big role to play in this easier race.

quotes.race: BetMGM EBF 'National Hunt' Novices' Hurdle (Qualifier) (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Sorceleur is a hardy horse and came out of Friday like he'd never been anywhere. I think I've had horses run on consecutive days six times and they've all won. He had a canter round at Exeter and he's won two nice pots. We won't run for a little while and look for a good race over Christmas - Paul Nicholls, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: He had good bumper form last season, notably an impressive Taunton win and a decent effort at Aintree in a Grade 2 when he didn't get a clear run, and should now develop into a decent novice hurdler. Considering he was as big as a bull, he not surprisingly got a bit tired on his jumping debut at Exeter last month after looking the likely winner for most of the way up the straight. Harry [Cobden] wasn't hard on him - one of the things I love about his riding - and came back in and said, ‘Winner next time', so given the improvement I'm anticipating, he looks a readymade winner of a novice hurdle. 04-11-24

runners.name: John Barbour
runners.comment: Comfortable winner of modest race last month; probably still has potential
runners.spotlight: Good-ground bumper winner; clear second to very useful rival on hurdle debut at Ludlow (2m, good to soft) in February and did not need to improve to win a modest race very comfortably last month; has more on his plate today but probably still has potential.

quotes.race: John Haine Memorial Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: John Barbour is full of ability but he's very quirky. When he won his first bumper he beat some lovely horses and then the next day didn't really go to plan. He then travelled and jumped all at Ludlow. If you could guarantee he could focus his mind he'd be a very good horse. Johnny [Burke] does a brilliant job on him. He's the sort of horse we might look at the Persian War with. We'll run him again because he needs experience, even if he's beaten - Fergal O'Brien, trainer.

runners.name: Kientzheim
runners.comment: Perhaps a shade disappointing last time but impressed on hurdle debut two runs ago
runners.spotlight: 2-3 in French bumpers in early part of last year and created a pretty good impression when winning readily on hurdle debut at Kempton (2m, good) on Boxing Day; perhaps a shade disappointing when only third of five at Newbury (2m, soft; again raced freely) in February but remains of interest.

quotes.race: Ladbrokes "Gaffer Of All Accas" Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Kientzheim is related to Epatante, so it's lovely as she's a sweet filly too. She jumped really well until they really kicked on, but she's a novice. She'll have to grow up a bit more, but I'd think she can go up to some nicer races now. This was a lovely race to start in - Nicky Henderson, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: She's closely related to Epatante and is in good form ? we like her a lot. She's neat and has been running in some pretty good AQPS Flat races, but we'll find a lot more about her here. 23-12-24

runners.name: Monticello
runners.comment: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two soft-ground hurdle races this year
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at triple-digit odds in two soft-ground hurdle races this year; may improve on the quicker surface here but still can't be recommended.

3:50.race_name: Golf And Gallop Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Herewegohoney

prev_owners.owner: Middleham Park Racing & C And J Hobkirk

runners.comment: Out of form over fences and hurdles since returning last summer from a break
runners.spotlight: Badly out of form over hurdles and fences since returning last summer from a layoff; lurks on a dangerous mark and will be suited by today's trip/ground but needs to turn a corner.

runners.name: Pipers Cross
runners.comment: Battled on well to lead close home at Fontwell (3m2f) last month; 4lb higher here
runners.spotlight: Came good for Emma Lavelle at fifth attempt, battling on well to lead close home at Fontwell (3m2f, good to soft) last month; 4lb rise probably demands a career-best performance here but she should handle the forecast faster ground.

stable_tour.quote: Cameron Johnstone-Baker, who was my first full-time employee, rides her. He saved up his money and bought her on his own at the sales, so I was proud of him for doing that. She's just one to help him get going as he's an inexperienced amateur having a go at riding. She'll win in turn and she's been a lovely spin for him the last twice. He just needs to improve his riding to get her over the line but it'll come. She'll definitely win a race somewhere and once she's got her head in front she could rack up a sequence. For a cheap purchase she's been a lot of fun. She's won £5,000 in prize-money already. 01-02-24

runners.name: Cluain Aodha
runners.owner: Mark Harrod, Bryan Agar & Nicky George
runners.comment: In-form front-runner who went down fighting at Huntingdon last month
runners.spotlight: Gamely made all to double hurdling tally at Huntingdon (3m1f, good) in February, and lost out by only a neck over that C&D last month; this left-handed track will also suit her and she can make another bold bid.

quotes.race: Season Tickets On Sale Now Mares' Handicap Hurdle
quotes.quote: Cluain Aodha toughed that out and she preferred going right-handed here rather than Fakenham. That is four winners out of our past five runners and things could not be going better - Neil King, trainer.

runners.name: Ebselysees
runners.comment: Just a respectable third on last month's handicap debut; moves up from 2m3f today
runners.spotlight: Yet to progress from her winning hurdle debut at Huntingdon (2m3f, good) in November and was just a respectable third over that C&D on last month's handicap debut (first-time cheekpieces); might have untapped potential over this longer trip but others appeal more.

runners.name: Faerie Cutlass
runners.comment: Ended 2024 with string of good efforts; contender if in same form after four-month break
runners.spotlight: Ended last year with string of good efforts, most notably a clear win at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) two starts ago; will be right in the thick of things if ready to roll after four-month break.

runners.name: Perculator
runners.comment: In good form in the autumn but form slumped in the winter; back from 12-week break
runners.spotlight: Placed on consecutive outings after her narrow win at Wetherby (2m5f, good) in November but looked out of sorts on her last two outings and needs to have been refreshed by a 12-week break.

quotes.race: William Hill Daily Bet Boost Novices' Handicap Hurdle (GBB Race)
quotes.quote: Perculator is only a little mare but she's very tough. We knew she stays well and she won a bumper on soft ground. She lost her way a bit but it was a good run at Newcastle, where she needed it a touch, and she did it well today - Mark Walford, trainer.

runners.name: Our Pink Lady
runners.comment: Runner-up twice last month (2m3f/2m4f); can pose a threat if stamina holds out today
runners.spotlight: Won twice here (2m4f, soft) last March and was back in good form last month, finishing second on consecutive outings (2m3f/2m4f, good); yet to convince stamina-wise over 3m but still enters calculations.

stable_tour.quote: She was bought from Ireland and was overrated by the handicapper when she first came, which I think is the case with quite a few lower-grade Irish horses. She's now dropped to a mark of 95, so she can get into a Class 5 and I'm sure she'll be very competitive at that level. She travelled well at Ludlow but didn't quite get home on the rain-softened ground. She'll be dropped in trip and probably go to Catterick just before Christmas. 06-12-23

runners.name: Jacksbar
runners.comment: Stoutly bred and improving mare; commands respect on this first attempt at 3m
runners.spotlight: Displayed a significant jolt of improvement when winning by over 6l at Uttoxeter (2m4f, soft) in December, her third handicap, and posted another good effort when keeping-on second at Exeter (2m2f, good) last month; has stamina in her pedigree and commands respect on this first attempt at 3m.

runners.name: Aazza
runners.comment: 3-18 over hurdles after last month's Wetherby win; possibly vulnerable after 5lb rise
runners.spotlight: Kept on well to justify favouritism at Wetherby (3m, good) last month and is now 3-18 over hurdles; might be a shade vulnerable after recent 5lb rise but at least we know she's in good heart.

5:00.race_name: Play At The Races Stableduel Conditional Jockeys' Novices' Handicap Hurdle

runners.name: Ballyvaughan Bay
runners.comment: C&D winner off 2lb lower last spring and returned from break with pleasing run last month
runners.spotlight: Returned from six-month break with a very encouraging run last month and is now only 2lb higher than when making all in 12-runner C&D contest (good) last spring; could take some catching.

runners.name: Heaven Smart
runners.breeder: Ecurie Smart Elevage Chevaux De Courses
runners.comment: Out of form over hurdles and fences since the autumn; needs to stop the rot
runners.spotlight: Regressive 8yo who can't blame the slow ground for his string of disappointing hurdle/chase runs since the autumn; very well handicapped now but needs to stop the rot; refitted blinkers the headgear of choice today.

runners.name: Kankin
runners.comment: Kept on from the rear for never-dangerous fourth on last month's hurdling return (2m5f)
runners.spotlight: Lost his way over fences this season and it's tricky to weigh up what he achieved when keeping on from the rear for never-dangerous fourth in rather an odd tactical race on last month's hurdling return at Fontwell (2m5f, good); worth another crack at a staying trip but others appeal more.

quotes.race: Daily Charged Up Offers At Rhino.Bet Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Kankin has schooled really well at home from day one and I was quite confident that fences would be the making of him. I thought he might have needed it as our horses have just been needing their first start. I thought if he ran well and was in the first three I would be happy enough but he has exceeded that - Alex Hales, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: A lovely son of Archipenko who finished a half-length second in a Market Rasen bumper 12 months ago on his only start to date. Sadly, he picked up an injury at his owner's place in the summer, but he is back now and in good order. He will be ready to roll by the end of next month and we will stick to bumpers for this term as he is potentially the best baby we have and is definitely one to note. 30-12-21

runners.name: Dublin To Milan
runners.comment: Well beaten on handicap debut in January but last month's Stratford second was much better
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on handicap debut in January (2m3f, soft) but was evidently much better suited by combination of 2m6f and good ground when second of 12 at Stratford last month and is open to more improvement over today's longer trip.

runners.name: Marengo Bay
runners.comment: Showed little in his qualifying races but represents a top stable and is very unexposed
runners.spotlight: Well beaten over 2m on hurdling debut in November and pulled up on both subsequent appearances (2m4f/2m3f); can't be recommended on that evidence but represents a top stable and is very unexposed; upped in trip and fitted with cheekpieces for handicap debut; market may guide.

runners.name: Jewel Eyed Judy
runners.breeder: John Goodman & The Late Owen Brennan
runners.comment: Made underwhelming start to handicap career over 2m5f; tries a new trip today
runners.spotlight: Safely held when fifth on handicap debut at Plumpton (2m5f, good to soft) in December and pulled up (albeit on soft ground) over that trip the following month; in good hands and remains lightly raced but needs to take a big step forward on this first 3m attempt.

runners.name: East Eagle
runners.owner: Mrs Janet Cooper & M E Sowersby
runners.comment: Second on handicap debut in October but form has nosedived; had wind op last month
runners.spotlight: Belied 40-1 odds when second on handicap debut at Market Rasen (2m7f, good) in October and is now 10lb below that mark but his form has nosedived; needs recent wind op to have made a big difference.

runners.name: Jumble Jury
runners.comment: No threat to front pair when third on handicap debut here; moves up from 2m4f today
runners.spotlight: No threat to front pair when keeping on for modest third here (2m4f, good) on recent handicap debut but some positives can be drawn from that performance and he might be seen in a better light over today's longer trip.

runners.name: Top Drawer
runners.comment: 0-20 over hurdles; 5lb wrong here and has too much to prove
runners.spotlight: 0-20 over hurdles; well behind Dublin To Milan at Stratford last month, after a 619-day absence, and has too much to prove; 5lb wrong.

2:05.race_name: Grace And Dotty Fedora's And Feathers Handicap Chase

runners.name: Fever Dream
runners.owner: Bedford & Noel & The Cant Say No
runners.comment: 0-6 over fences but on a good mark and will be suited by today's trip/ground
runners.spotlight: Safely held after bad jumping error on final circuit here (2m4f, good to soft) in February and now 0-6 over fences, but today's trip-and-ground combination ought to suit him better and he remains on a good mark; had wind op last month; one to consider.

runners.name: Cokytho
runners.comment: In good form last spring but returned from layoff with three disappointing winter runs
runners.spotlight: In good form last spring, most notably when scoring by 8l off today's mark at Uttoxeter (3m, soft), but he returned from a layoff with three disappointing runs in December/January; had another wind op (his third) during latest 12-week break and needs to get his career back on track.

runners.name: Big Bee Hive
runners.comment: Three-time chase winner; signalled possible return to form over C&D in February
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner (once here) who is usually ridden very patiently; generally disappointing since returning in October from a break, but signalled a possible return to form when keeping-on fifth over C&D in February and might be boosted by the refitted cheekpieces today.

quotes.race: Cannonwood Handicap Hurdle (Rated 80-95)
quotes.quote: Big Bee Hive ran a blinder at Punchestown last time for Phidelma (Elvin). He won't go on summer ground and he probably doesn't handle heavy. I would say he'll improve and hopefully we can find another little race for him - Philip Rothwell, trainer.

stable_tour.quote: Sam: He doesn't like pressure and has taken time. Jonathan: He's only just started to get things together and last time out, when he finished third at Sedgefield, was the first time he's shown signs there might be races to win with him. He'll appreciate nicer ground and will probably go chasing in the spring, but he should be able to win off 84. I rode him to give him every chance to get 2m4f last time, but he'll probably stay further. 08-02-24

runners.name: Faitque De Lisle
runners.comment: Revitalised 10yo who won twice at Ludlow in February; respected in that form
runners.spotlight: Revitalised 10yo who won twice under Lucy Turner at Ludlow (3m, good to soft/soft) in February; hiked up 9lb for the latter success but he did it pretty comfortably and will be fine on the faster ground here.

stable_tour.quote: He came to us after racing in France as well as a spell with Ed de Giles in England and had shown glimpses of form but not got his head in front. We gave him one run last season before putting him away and bringing him back at Stratford, where he ran a nice race to be third over 2m3½f. Stepping him up to 3m clearly had the desired effect as he won next time out at Ffos Las. It was a big step forward from him and clearly staying chasing is his game. He jumped very well at the Welsh track and got every inch of the 3m. We could head up to Newcastle on Thursday with him as there a couple of options there for him. He is up to a mark of 100 now and I would like to think from what he has done so far that there is more in the tank. 21-11-22

runners.name: Cloudy Wednesday
runners.comment: Back from break with three good runs this year; suited by good ground; in the mix again
runners.spotlight: Three-time chase winner on good ground (2m4f-3m); back from break with three good efforts this year, most recently when third at Huntingdon (2m4f, good) five weeks weeks ago; probably won't be far away.

quotes.race: Racing TV Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Cloudy Wednesday likes this ground and it's done nothing but rain until now. He's had a busy time so I might give him a break after that - Caroline Fryer, trainer.

runners.name: Martalmixjac
runners.breeder: Mrs L & Mr J Grandchamp Des Raux
runners.comment: Went close over C&D in February but finished tired in Stratford marathon on Sunday
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on consecutive outings during the winter, losing out only by a short head over C&D on latter occasion, but was tired and well beaten when third over a marathon trip at Stratford on Sunday.

quotes.race: Re-Gen Waste Novices' Handicap Chase
quotes.quote: Martalmix'jac hinted he's got ability many times. We've gone to the races on the back of good runs thinking, 'Today is the day', then he's put a stinker in. He seems to like it around here and has put it all together. It wasn't the strongest race, but you've still got to win them. He was going away at the line and this was probably his perfect trip. He's not one to be slogging around in the mud. He wants summer jumping, but he might be able to nick one before his season is out. He should go in again - Alex Edwards, jockey, speaking on Racing TV.

stable_tour.quote: He's turned into a really consistent campaigner, having been a little nondescript to start with. He was quite a closed book in knowing what ground he preferred and even his ideal distance, but he's turned into a very consistent sort. We can place him where he can be most competitive and he keeps pulling it out of the bag in those handicap chases around 2m4f. 16-01-25

runners.name: Moro Rock
runners.comment: 0-9 over hurdles; makes chasing debut after 268-day absence; probably best watched
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles; runner-up off 2lb higher at Market Rasen (2m7f, good) last June but absent since two lesser efforts the following month and probably best watched on this chasing debut; had wind op in January.

runners.name: Dysania
runners.comment: Second over C&D on New Year's Day but has modest strike-rate and often races lazily
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for second over C&D (soft) on New Year's Day and is effectively 3lb lower today but has modest strike-rate over fences (1-19) and often races lazily; probably better suited by soft ground; others preferred.

runners.name: Mistertommyshelby
runners.comment: 17-race maiden; out of form over hurdles when last seen last summer
runners.spotlight: 17-race maiden who was out of form over hurdles in the early part of this season; 7lb out of the weights for this return to fences and could be considered only if lively in the betting.

2:40.race_name: Join Southwell Golf Club Handicap Chase

runners.name: Pep Talking
runners.comment: Made all in first-time cheekpieces at Hereford last month; major player here
runners.spotlight: Made all for comfortable success in first-time cheekpieces at Hereford (2m5f, good) last month and is now 4-10 over fences; doesn't have to lead and should also be suited by this left-handed track; major player if the headgear continues to aid him.

runners.name: Stardhem
runners.comment: 2-2 since switched to fences in February, gaining both wins at Huntingdon; respected
runners.spotlight: 2-2 since switched to fences in February, gaining both wins over 2m4f at Huntingdon (good to soft/good); latest 8lb rise asks a question of him but he might still be on the upgrade and commands respect.

runners.name: We Got Your Back
runners.comment: Might be better suited by 2m on slower ground but is in good form and enters calculations
runners.spotlight: Won twice on soft ground during the winter (2m/1m7f) and posted another good effort when second here (2m, good to soft) six weeks ago; not certain to be ideally suited by combination of return to 2m4f and forecast good ground today but still considered.

runners.name: Ensel Du Perche
runners.comment: Front-runner; in good form at around 2m but does not have a persuasive record over 2m4f
runners.spotlight: Made all in two small fields at Catterick (1m7f, soft/good) during the winter and comes here after a very respectable second at Market Rasen (2m1f, good) three weeks ago; may face competition for the early lead from Pep Talking, though, and record over 2m4f is not persuasive.

runners.name: Coolmoyne
runners.comment: Ran well when when second at Doncaster two starts ago but has modest strike-rate
runners.spotlight: 1-24 over fences, the win for a different stable at Hexham (3m, good to soft) last May; ran well when second of five at Doncaster (2m4f, good) in February but was below that form when back at Hexham last month and is not the percentage call here.

runners.name: Small Town Hero
runners.comment: Soundly beaten in all three handicap hurdles; still worth market check before chase debut
runners.spotlight: 0-6 over hurdles, having been soundly beaten in three handicaps in February/March (2m-3m); has a lot to prove on this chasing debut but he won a small-field Irish point last year and is worth keeping an eye on in the betting.

runners.name: King Of The Hill
runners.comment: 0-16 under all codes but ran game race in defeat at Warwick last month, after a break
runners.spotlight: 0-16 under all codes but ran a game race in defeat at Warwick (2m4f, good) last month, after a layoff, and can cope with subsequent 2lb nudge if in similar form.
